intro: Phaca leucopsis, commonly known as the white-flowered phaca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or along stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, similar to those of other members of the carrot family. Phaca leucopsis is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
